page.title: 04Looking at Flowers and Trees
page.content:
continued from Page 3
There were plenty of hops along Slack Lane.We wondered if they had come originally from the nearby farm, the farmer using them to brew his own beer or perhaps they would have been seeded rom Brewers Grains which is used as a cattle food.There was more vetch,rattle and dead bluebells.We turned South East into Hermitage Lane and soon found the new path.We walked along it back to school in a North Easterly direction.On the walk we had seen a wide variety of trees:oak,ash,syucamore,holly and elder but,sadly,many dead elms.One farmer, Mr.Gilbert Prince,told us he had lost over 100 elms on his land,every one he had.
